page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY OF CORHAMPTON
page.content:
Around 70 A.D. Romans landing at Southampton moved inland over Corhampton Down and camped there naming it Beati Mundae (most blessed place in the world).About 200 years ago a woman of low repute waylaid and robbed travellers disposing of the bodies in the well of her cottage. She became known as Betty Mundy and the lane is still Betty Mundy's Bottom. The route changed to Sailor's Lane.
The site of an old fortress on Stephen Castle Down has been confirmed by aerial photographs.
The Church ceremony of Beating the Bounds (walking the parish boundary) still takes place every spring at Rogationtide.
